channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Officials Say Russia Is Unlikely to Take Much More Ukrainian Territory
item.description: Russian forces continue to inflict pain, but NATO leaders gathering in Washington can say that their efforts to strengthen Ukraine are working.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Residents Flee as Israeli Troops Push Deeper Into Gaza City
item.description: For a second day, ground troops pressed forward into the Gaza Strip’s largest city, forcing residents who had returned there earlier this year to flee again.

item.title: Wall Street titan warns that job titles come and go but the only thing that matters is character
item.description: TIAA CEO Thasunda Brown Duckett insists she is not her title. ‘I earned it, but I don’t own it.’

item.title: Ariane 6 Launch Video: Watch Europe’s Latest Rocket Flight
item.description: Ariane 6, put into development by the European Space Agency a decade ago, finally reached orbit on Tuesday, restoring the continent’s ability to get to space without foreign help.

item.title: U.S. Officials Say Russia Is Unlikely to Take Much More Ukrainian Territory
item.description: Russian forces continue to inflict pain, but NATO leaders gathering in Washington can say that their efforts to strengthen Ukraine are working.

item.title: VanEck and 21Shares file for Solana ETFs—a ‘bet’ on a Trump victory
item.description: The SEC has until March to decide on Solana ETFs. The real deadline, however, will be November's election.

item.title: The Talented Democrats Who Aren’t Running for President
item.description: It’s getting harder to ignore the charismatic politicians who have been trying to support Biden.

item.title: A Children’s Hospital in Ukraine Becomes a Scene of Destruction
item.description: Families and patients were not unfamiliar with the sound of missiles flying overhead. But the Russian assault on the hospital marked one of the worst days of violence against civilians in months.

item.title: Barcelona residents are so fed up with tourism they’re squirting visitors with water guns as they try to enjoy their meals
item.description: Locals argue that tourism isn't helping with soaring housing costs, precarious employment, and a lower quality of life.

item.title: James M. Inhofe, Senator Who Denied Climate Change, Dies at 89
item.description: An Oklahoma Republican who led the Environment Committee, he took hard-right stands on many issues but was especially vocal in challenging evidence of global warming.

item.title: Cigarette Smuggling in Gaza Turns Aid Trucks Into Targets
item.description: Organized looters are attacking aid convoys in search of contraband cigarettes, officials say, as needed aid languishes.

item.title: Retailer bans personal checks after rise in fraud
item.description: Walmart, Macy’s and Kohl’s are among the retailers that still accept personal checks at their stores.

item.title: A Children’s Hospital in Ukraine Becomes a Scene of Destruction
item.description: Families and patients were not unfamiliar with the sound of missiles flying overhead. But the Russian assault on the hospital marked one of the worst days of violence against civilians in months.

item.title: Modi’s Russia Visit Showcases a Less Isolated Putin, Angering Ukraine
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India made his first visit to Russia in five years, even as Ukraine reeled from an attack on a children’s hospital.

item.title: Microsoft ordered employees in China to only use iPhones due to security threats
item.description: The move is the latest example of the U.S. and China banning each other's tech products as the two superpowers build diverging digital ecosystems.
